DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was a diagnosis of a malignant neoplasm of the opposite, previously uninvolved, breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnosis of a malignant neoplasm of the opposite, previously uninvolved, breast.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side (of the body):One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been diagnosed with opposite breast cancer

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had contralateral breast cancer (including DCIS) at any time

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with a history of DCIS or synchronous DCIS of the contralateral breast regardless of therapy are eligible

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have synchronous or previous contralateral invasive breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have synchronous or previous contralateral invasive breast cancer or DCIS?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had contralateral breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have synchronous ipsilateral invasive breast cancer or any prior history or ipsilateral invasive breast cancer
